Solomon Duskis wrote:
> That's interesting.  
> 
> Is a non-standard METHOD better than an ambiguous use of a standard METHOD?

I won't get into what "standard" means, or provide a yes/no answer. But 
I think the time to choose a new method is when the operation you want 
is subtly different, but very similar to a well-defined method.

Bill
